subject: Writing
title: The Catcher in the Rye and Its Dark Legacy
description: One-minute skill: The Catcher in the Rye and Its Dark Legacy.

hook.text: J.D. Salinger's novel was found in the possession of three different assassins. Coincidence haunted the book.

buildup.text: The Catcher in the Rye was banned for profanity, sexual content, and promoting teenage rebellion.

discovery.text: Mark David Chapman carried a copy when he killed John Lennon. John Hinckley and Robert Bardo had copies too.

twist.text: The book is about a lonely teenager seeking authenticity â€” not violence. But its fame attracted disturbed readers.

climax.text: Despite controversy, it has sold over 65 million copies and remains a touchstone of American literature.

punchline.text: A book about alienation became the most controversial novel in America.

quiz.question: How many copies has The Catcher in the Rye sold?
